column4: hi. im trying to install ubuntu but it keeps freezing up on me
i've tried 6.06 PC, 6.06 PC64 and 6.10 and they all freeze =(
when its loading the install. all the progress bars go through, then a peach screen comes up and theres a grey line with lots of weird colors in the middle
Start Ubuntu in safe graphics mode ?
same thing. it stops right after playing some audio clip
if you hit Ctrl+Alt+F2, do you get a console?
how do i go back to the UI?
ctrl+alt+F7, but i'm not sure that will help (but try)
well i suggest you do a "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg" in the console that you have, and see if you can get X in a working state
is there a way that i can install without the GUI?
yes, you can use the Alternate CD
however, if the GUI doesn't work in the Desktop CD, chances are it won't work in your installation...
i don't know, i *could* tell you to try the alternate CD, but it might just end up in wasted time for you
